text: Andriyivka (Ukrainian: Андріївка; Hungarian: Andrásháza) is a village in the Zakarpattia Oblast of western Ukraine. == History == Before the Treaty of Trianon it belonged to Hungary. In 1910, out of 452 inhabitants, 43 were Germans and 409 were Ruthenians. Of these, 8 were Roman Catholics, 401 were Greek Catholics, and 43 were Israelites. == More information == * Topographic map of the Soviet Union * Place-name directories of Hungary, 1873–1913 Category:Settlements of Uzhhorod District Category:Villages in Ukraine
title: Andriyivka
